snippet.textDisplay: ​@Mikasa Killed Eren because they are people under an authoritarian regime who have no freedom and their human rights are routinely violated.
snippet.textOriginal: ​@Mikasa Killed Eren because they are people under an authoritarian regime who have no freedom and their human rights are routinely violated.

snippet.textDisplay: @Arvin Basir I understand the point you are trying to make. Monarchy simply describes "who" is in power, not "how" they govern.  Monarchy is a structure of government whereas communism is an economic methodology.  Bottom line, NK is screwed up because of communism, not because of monarchy.  Even if you eliminated the monarch, NK would likely not change.  Instead, the communist torch would be picked up by another. So I guess, I'm saying that you are misdiagnosing the problem. The underlying Marx idea is collective ownership.  Many interpret this idea as a "paradise of equality" as you put it.  However, even in a perfect world, it would not produce a paradise because it eliminates the individual upon which the collective depends. Communism is a paradox and contradicts itself. Equality is only theoretically possible because communism strips individuals of personal agency making them all slaves to the collective. Earthy implementations consolidate power to a central state government resulting in authoritarian dictatorships which have universally failed to create equality by the very nature of a powerful state controlling the individual (inherently created two classes).  Again, a paradox.  Who is in power is irrelevant. The communist ideal is flawed at it's very core.  I recommend  reading "The Gulag Archipelago" to better understand communism.  NK is typically classified as one party socialist republic (which describes its economic method) totalitarian hereditary dictatorship (which describes who implements that economic method).  Again, as you said, hereditary dictatorship can be compared to a monarchy.
snippet.textOriginal: @Arvin Basir I understand the point you are trying to make. Monarchy simply describes "who" is in power, not "how" they govern.  Monarchy is a structure of government whereas communism is an economic methodology.  Bottom line, NK is screwed up because of communism, not because of monarchy.  Even if you eliminated the monarch, NK would likely not change.  Instead, the communist torch would be picked up by another. So I guess, I'm saying that you are misdiagnosing the problem. The underlying Marx idea is collective ownership.  Many interpret this idea as a "paradise of equality" as you put it.  However, even in a perfect world, it would not produce a paradise because it eliminates the individual upon which the collective depends. Communism is a paradox and contradicts itself. Equality is only theoretically possible because communism strips individuals of personal agency making them all slaves to the collective. Earthy implementations consolidate power to a central state government resulting in authoritarian dictatorships which have universally failed to create equality by the very nature of a powerful state controlling the individual (inherently created two classes).  Again, a paradox.  Who is in power is irrelevant. The communist ideal is flawed at it's very core.  I recommend  reading "The Gulag Archipelago" to better understand communism.  NK is typically classified as one party socialist republic (which describes its economic method) totalitarian hereditary dictatorship (which describes who implements that economic method).  Again, as you said, hereditary dictatorship can be compared to a monarchy.

snippet.textDisplay: @derekalineal No. Communism says everyone should be equal (which obviously would never happen in any parallel universe) and people are not equal in DPRK. Communism is like paradise, too good to be true, and will never ever happen. It started by Kim Il Sung and got passed to Kim Jong Il and now his son Kim Jong Un. Literally Monarchy. Like how else would you describe monarchy? From granddad all the way to grandson.
snippet.textOriginal: @derekalineal No. Communism says everyone should be equal (which obviously would never happen in any parallel universe) and people are not equal in DPRK. Like how else would you describe monarchy? From granddad all the way to grandson.

snippet.textDisplay: @Arvin Basir Sorry, but you are wrong.  NK is not a monarchy.  NK is the exact archetype of the communist ideology. The very idea is rotten at it's core.  If you don't understand this, you need to read "The Gulag Archipelago".
snippet.textOriginal: @Arvin Basir Sorry, but you are wrong.  NK is not a monarchy.  NK is the exact archetype of the communist ideology. The very idea is rotten at it's core.  If you don't understand this, you need to read "The Gulag Archipelago".
